page_content: Profile: Biswaranjita Mahapatra. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: biswaranjita.mahapatra@kiit.ac.in. Phone: Not available. Info: Biography: Ms. Biswaranjita Mahapatra is pursuing her Ph. D. in the area of Industrial Engineering and Management in the Department of Management Studies, Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Dhanbad, India. She did her B. Tech from College of Engineering and Technology, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India in the year 2007. Ms. Mahapatra has served College of Engineering and Technology, Bhubaneswar as a Lecturer from July 25, 2007 to July 15, 2011. Ms. Mahapatra is presently holding the position of Sr. Faculty at KIIT, Bhuaneswar. Her main research interest lies in the field of supplier selection, performance measurement, and application of optimization techniques for solving industrial problems. Ms. Mahapatra has published and presented number of papers related to her research interest in national/international journals and conferences. | Research Interest: supplier selection, supply chain management, performance measurement | Publications: SCI (Q2) indexed Mahapatra, B., Bhar, C.andMondal.S (2020), “Performance Assessment based on the relative efficiency of Indian Opencast Coal mines using Data Envelopment Analysis and Malmquist Productivity Index”, Energies , Vol 13(18), 4902 https://doi.org/10.3390/en13184902 Others Singh, R., Mahapatra, B., Mukherjee,K. and Bhar, C.(2015), “Application of DEA for Performance Evaluation of Indian Microfinance Institutions”, Asian Journal of Management Research, Vol 4, Iss 3, pp. 597-605 Mahapatra, B., Mukherjee,K. and Bhar, C.(2015), “Performance Measurement- An DEA-AHP based approach”, Journal of Advance Management Studies, Engineering Technology Publisher , USA Vol 3, Iss 1, pp. 26-30. LIST OF PAPERS PRESENTED IN INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE Mahapatra, B., Mukherjee,K. and Bhar, C.,(2012) ” Supply chain performance management-an extensive literature survey “, Proceeding of the  16th International conference by society of operations management(SOM) at IIT, Delhi,  December 21 – 23. Mahapatra, B., Mukherjee,K. and Bhar, C.,(2013) ” Supplier Selection and Evaluation using Analytic Hierarchy Model”, Proceeding of the  11th AIMS International Conference, IMT, Gaziabad,  December 21 – 24. Mahapatra, B., Mukherjee,K. and Bhar, C.,(2013) ” Supply chain performance measurement using DEA/AHP model”, Proceeding of the  7th ISDSI &  5th OSCM International Conference, IMI, New Delhi,  December 28 – 30. Mahapatra, B., Mukherjee,K. and Bhar, C.,(2014) ” A Hybrid model for Operational performance evaluation and vendor selection”, Proceeding of the  4th International Management Convention, ASBM Bhubaneswar, February 06 – 08.
Profile: Unknown. Role: Faculty. Email: Not available. Phone: Not available. Info:

Profile: Vanshika Khare. Role: Faculty Associates. Email: soft@kiit.ac.in. Phone: Not available. Info: Biography: Ms. Vanshika Khare has graduate (B.Des) in Fashion and Apparel Design from Vogue Institute of Fashion Technology, Bangalore. She has completed her Masters in Fashion Design from Inter National Institute of Fashion Design, Bhopal. She has been running her own business for more than 2 years now. She has been associated with teaching for about a year. She has worked with brands like Redesyn, where she was a part of design team designing for celebrities like Amitabh Bachchan, Ranveer Singh, Lt. Irfan Khan, to name a few. She has also worked with Centre for Research and Industrial Staff Performance – Department of Technical Education, Skill Development and Employment, Madhya Pradesh. She has created artworks inspired from different parts of India for a Hotel Project in Bhubaneswar where she painted Madhubani, Patta Chitra, Kalamkari, etc. She has a passion for travelling and has travelled across different countries to explore the world of fashion, cultures and heritage. His area of competency are Pattern Making, Garment Construction, Surface Ornamentation Technique, Fashion Illustration, Sustainable Fashion. Research interest : – Indian Weaves, Weavers and Artisans, Sustainable Fashion, Legal aspects to Fashion Design. Profile: Padma Charan Majhi. Role: Assistant Professor. Email: padma.majhisoft@kiit.ac.in. Phone: Not available. Info: Biography: Padma Charan Majhi, Textile Designer, a graduate in Textile Design from National Institute of Fashion Technology(NIFT), Kolkata and done post graduate in Journalism & Mass Communication. Currently he is an Assistant professor in School of Fashion Technology, KIIT University. His areas of teaching are Elements of Design, Design Process, Elements & Textile Design Techniques, Print Design, Weave Design, CAD for print and Handloom Textile & Craft Design. He served NIFT as an assistant professor for almost 10yrs and SIDAC, Govt. of Odisha for 1.5yrs as a course coordinator cum Designer. Worked in industry as a designer for Mahajan Overseas, Panipath and its co-brand ‘Maspar’ a high-end Home fashion category for domestic and international. Also, worked as designer for 1year in SADHAC, Govt. of Odisha. Research Interest: Textile Designing, Traditional Textiles, Traditional Art of India, Woven Designing, Handloom and Craft Design, Sustainable Textile Publications: Presented paper on ‘Design & Product Diversification in handloom Sector for Export Market ‘ at seminar conducted by Handloom Export Promotion Council (HEPC), Chennai held in Bhubaneswar and Bargarh Odisha. Presented paper on “Design & product innovation as on Trend” for Handicrafts, held in Bhubaneswar, conducted by National Design Center (NDC) New Delhi. Odisha Handloom textiles and the Process of shift to Natural Dye, Presented in the 3rd National Conference, KIIT in 2024 Offiice Responsibility: – Syllabus and Workshop – Internship & Graduation Project – Placement (member) – Laboratory incharge – Cultural club head (School level) Padma Charan Majhi, Textile Designer, a graduate in Textile Design from National Institute of Fashion Technology(NIFT), Kolkata and done post graduate in Journalism & Mass Communication. Currently he is an Assistant professor in School of Fashion Technology, KIIT University. Worked in industry as a designer for Mahajan Overseas, Panipath and its co-brand ‘Maspar’ a high-end Home fashion category for domestic and international. Also, worked as designer for 1year in SADHAC, Govt. of Odisha. | Research Interest: Textile Designing, Traditional Textiles, Traditional Art of India, Woven Designing, Handloom and Craft Design, Sustainable Textile | Publications: Presented paper on ‘Design & Product Diversification in handloom Sector for Export Market ‘ at seminar conducted by Handloom Export Promotion Council (HEPC), Chennai held in Bhubaneswar and Bargarh Odisha. Presented paper on “Design & product innovation as on Trend” for Handicrafts, held in Bhubaneswar, conducted by National Design Center (NDC) New Delhi. Odisha Handloom textiles and the Process of shift to Natural Dye, Presented in the 3rd National Conference, KIIT in 2024 | Offiice Responsibility: – Syllabus and Workshop – Internship & Graduation Project – Placement (member) – Laboratory incharge – Cultural club head (School level)

Profile: Rajakishor Moharana. Role: Master Trainer. Email: rajakishor.moharana@kiit.ac.in. Phone: Not available. Info: Mr. RajakishorMoharana: is a professional contemporary and traditional artist with more than ten years of experience Academics in the field of Fashion and Textile Illustration and design. He did his graduation in bachelor’s in fine art (5 Years) From Utkal University, Odisha. He was certified as Patachitra expert by Govt. of India Ministry of Textile. He completed his course in Block Printing from weaver’s center, Bhubaneswar, under Ministry of Textile. He received many national and international awards for best Traditional Artist from Sanskar Bharati Bhopal, S.C.Z.C.C Nagpur. He received the International award for mask painting from Chitrakar University, Punjab. He attended different level of national and state level camps workshops for Artists and designers. Before joining KIIT he worked as a Vocational Teacher (Traditional Painting) at Kendriya Vidyalaya, RBNMP, Midinapore, and West Bengal. Research Interest : Indian Traditional and contemporary Art, Textile Printing and designing, Traditional Costume design. Publications : Embracing Sustainability Eco Print – Infusing with Nature Ms.Laxmi Thapa  and Mr.Raja Kishor Moharana, Presented in  the 3rd National Conference, KIIT in 2024 | Projects: Master Trainer in Pattachitra conducted by GOVT. OF INDIA, MINISTRY OF TEXTILE, OFFICE OF DEVELOPMENT COMMISSIONER (HANDICRAFTS), NEW DELHI.

Profile: Bauri Raula. Role: Dean. Email: braula@kiit.ac.in. Phone: Not available. Info: Biography: Mr. BauriRaula is professionally qualified in M.Design from NIFT Delhi and MBA (IB) from Indian Institute of Foreign Trade (IIFT -Delhi) having more than 10 years in Academic since 2010 and 16 Years Industry work experience Design & development ,Merchandising & International Marketing cum Business development portfolio of Textile & Costumes Accessories in Apparel &Textile Manufacturing cum Export Organizations located in N.Delhi ,Panipat (Haryana ) and Noida (U.P) . Prof Raula was closely associated with the Team of Creative & Merchandising Heads in CRATE & BARREL, POTTERY BARN , NEXT ,ZARA ,WALMART , KMART ,WOOLWORTHS , LIMITED EDITION , MACY , BLOOMING DALES ,SEARS , HOUSE OF FRASER (UK) ,EDEN OF GARDEN(UK) , ,DESIGNER GUILD (London ), MANGO ,SPRING, SPIEGEL, TRIMAR, HEINE,DESCAMPS.BESTTRENDS, MAYTEX, ELECTRA HOBBY-LOBBY, NEXT, OTTO-DORSAN, EUROPEAN HOME, COUNTRY ROAD, DOMESTICATION, DE-CAMPO, GK FINE, , JAB, PAMEC, ELEGANT, EXCLUSIVE, CALZEDONIA, MORI MODA, ALOZA,THE EAST, HOME COLLECTION (OTTO), ROMANI HOUSE, LIMITED EDITION,LINEN & THINGS, AND OTHER ASIAN COUNTRIES :JAPAN,KOREA, SINGAPORE, MALAYSIA & UAE COUNTRIES . MOHAWK FLOORINGS, SUPERTEX, IKEA, PARK AVENUE, HOME DECOR from USA ,EU&ASIAN Buyers Importers.& Retail Brands Prof.Raula has conducted many creative workshop on Home linen for Luxury Sleeping ,Fashion Accessories for Fashion lovers and luxury Stylization seekers .Print Design for Costume Accessories and Luxury Homes in Home furnishing Industry &Academic Institutions in Delhi /NCR .Prof.Raula is presently holding the profile of Dean and Course Coordinator of The School of Fashion Technology . in addition to he is active memberof VariousCommittee under KIIT University. | Research Interest: 1) Designing forSustainability, 2) Innovation & Conservation for Eco Balance , 3) Textile&Apparel Industry Waste for Recycle and Sustainability, 4) Traditional Craft Design for Luxury Lovers , 5) Revival of costume and culture of India , 6) Revival of Heritage Art & Craft Skills for Sustainability . 7) Natural Fiberand Natural Dyes for Eco Earth, Water, Air & Fire | Publications: Journal of Material Cycle &Waste Management (JMCWM) (Research Paper “ Textile and apparel industries waste and its sustainable management approaches”)SUSTAINABILITY FOR TEXTILE AND FASHION INDUSTRY A fresh approach to the design process is being sought through Fashion and Sustainable Strategies Prof.BauriRaula, Associate Professor, School of Fashion Technology, KIIT, Bhubaneswar, Presented in 3rd National Conference | Projects: Project funding of 87.00 lakhs from HHEPC ministry of Textile &Handicraft govt of India .New Delhi for Skill up gradation for Rural Artisans in the Traditional Patachitra Painting Skills & Hand Embroidery for the project duration 2012 -2017

Profile: Parthasarathi Bal. Role: Faculty Associate. Email: parthasarathi.bal@kiit.ac.in. Phone: Not available. Info: Biography: Mr. Parthasarathi Bal completed his +2 from BuxiJagabandhuBidyadhar Junior college. He got his Bachelor of Design (Fashion) Degree from KIIT School of Fashion Technology, KIIT University one of the renowned institutes of India. He has completed his master’s in design from Choudhary Charan Sing University, Meerut. Mr. Bal has done his internship under famous retail companies like Reliance & Pantaloon. He worked as a Fresher in “Christian Heritage” south ext., New Delhi having 1-year Experience. He also conducted many creative workshops on appliqué, face painting, clay modeling & Portfolio in many institutes.  With 8 years of Teaching experience presently he was holding the position of Faculty Associate in KIIT, Bhubaneswar. | Research Interest: Fashion Designing, Sustainable Fashion, History of Art & Design, Fiber & Fabrics 3D Clo, Photoshop, InDesign. Publications: Sustainable Banana Fabric Development Presented in the 3rd National Conference, KIIT in 2024

Profile: Vikram Kumar. Role: Senior faculty associate. Email: vikram.kumarfft@kiit.ac.in. Phone: Not available. Info: Biography: Mr. Vikram Kumar has done graduate (B. Des) in fashion design from NIFT, New Delhi in 2009. He has completed his Masters in Anthropology from IGNOU, New Delhi. He has 9 years’ industrial experience. He has worked as Sr. Fashion Designer in King Dorian export house ,Utsav Fashion ,Orient Fashion , New Delhi and design for Zara, Mango, Isabel Marant, Zading & Voltaire etc. He has 6 Years teaching experience. he has also conduct different module as guest faculty at NIFT, DLCSUPVA, Rohtak, Haryana and other fashion institutes. He is Empanelled Designer in DC Handicraft (ministry of textile) from 2023. He has done design development program for Dc Handicraft like bamboo craft, applique, paper mache. He was also engaged in workshop for NGO and Skill India development program. His area of competency are pattern Making, Draping, Garment Construction, Surface Ornamentation Technique, Creative pattern Making and Fashion Illustration. Research interest: – Apparel Designing, Art, Craft & Culture, Macramé Publication : – A Study of select communities of Bihar through the material culture of Madhubani Painting Handloom weaver’s Situation in our society Madhubani and Bhagalpur (Bihar District) Observation at Madhubani Artists who changed their society thinking and saved culture Mr. Vikram Kumar has done graduate (B. Des) in fashion design from NIFT, New Delhi in 2009. He has completed his Masters in Anthropology from IGNOU, New Delhi. He has 9 years’ industrial experience. He has worked as Sr. Fashion Designer in King Dorian export house ,Utsav Fashion ,Orient Fashion , New Delhi and design for Zara, Mango, Isabel Marant, Zading & Voltaire etc. He has 6 Years teaching experience. he has also conduct different module as guest faculty at NIFT, DLCSUPVA, Rohtak, Haryana and other fashion institutes. He is Empanelled Designer in DC Handicraft (ministry of textile) from 2023. He has done design development program for Dc Handicraft like bamboo craft, applique, paper mache. He was also engaged in workshop for NGO and Skill India development program. His area of competency are pattern Making, Draping, Garment Construction, Surface Ornamentation Technique, Creative pattern Making and Fashion Illustration. Research interest: – Apparel Designing, Art, Craft & Culture, Macramé Publication : – A Study of select communities of Bihar through the material culture of Madhubani Painting Handloom weaver’s Situation in our society Madhubani and Bhagalpur (Bihar District) Observation at Madhubani Artists who changed their society thinking and saved culture

Profile: Laxmi Thapa. Role: Instructor- Design Lab. Email: laxmi.thapafft@kiit.ac.in. Phone: Not available. Info: Biography: Mrs. Laxmi Thapa has done her +2 from St. Mary’s College Shillong and her Graduation in Bachelor of Science (Apparel and Fashion Design) from Sikkim Manipal University. Also, she has assisted James Ferreira (fashion designer) in a fashion show held in Shillong. Mrs. Laxmi Thapa has also been an entrepreneur. Currently, she is working in KIIT University as an Instructor – Design Lab and she has completed her Masterand preparing for NET as the first step to a milestone to achieve her Dreams. Research Interest : Computer Aided Designing, Apparel and Accessories Designing, Surface Orientation, Print Design Publications: Embracing Sustainability Eco Print – Infusing with Nature Ms.Laxmi Thapa  and Mr.Raja Kishor Moharana, Presented in  the 3rd National Conference, KIIT in 2024 Mrs. Laxmi Thapa has done her +2 from St. Mary’s College Shillong and her Graduation in Bachelor of Science (Apparel and Fashion Design) from Sikkim Manipal University. Also, she has assisted James Ferreira (fashion designer) in a fashion show held in Shillong. Mrs. Laxmi Thapa has also been an entrepreneur. Currently, she is working in KIIT University as an Instructor – Design Lab and she has completed her Masterand preparing for NET as the first step to a milestone to achieve her Dreams. | Research Interest: Computer Aided Designing, Apparel and Accessories Designing, Surface Orientation, Print Design Publications: Embracing Sustainability Eco Print – Infusing with Nature Ms.Laxmi Thapa  and Mr.Raja Kishor Moharana, Presented in  the 3rd National Conference, KIIT in 2024

Profile: Laxman Soren. Role: Faculty Associate. Email: parthasarathi.bal@kiit.ac.in. Phone: Not available. Info: Biography: Mr. Laxman Sorenhas done his Advance Diploma in Fashion Design from IIFT. And a Arts Graduate from Ranchi University. MSc. Fashion Design and Management from TGOU Nagaland. Having good experience in pattern making, Draping& Grading.Taken training from Prof. Arvind K. Zarapkar a renowned international pattern designer of Mumbai, 10 yrs of teaching experience as a fashion design faculty in different fashion institutions.He conducts the different modules, like corset making, gown making, garment design development, creative pattern making module, grading module, advance draping module.worked with Fashion designers. He trained NGO group of teachers for pattern making and garment finishing. He has a experience of CAD (Lectra) and 3D Clo. | Research Interest: Apparel Designing, Traditional crafts ofIndia, Creative Pattern and Draping Publications: Odisha Handloom textiles and the Process of shift to Natural Dye Presented in the 3rd National Conference, KIIT in 2024

Profile: Monalisa Das. Role: Faculty Associate. Email: monalisa.das@kiit.ac.in. Phone: Not available. Info: Biography: Ms. Monalisa Das is continuing her Ph.D. degree in UUC. She completed her Diploma in Garment Technology from Women’s Polytechnic, Dhenakanal.  She pursued her B.Design degree in National Institute of Fashion Design, Bhubaneswar, affiliated with Utkal university of culture and received the University’s Gold Medal in, thereby achieving obtained a first-class bachelor’s degree in fashion design. She then pursued her master’s degree in textile design at Utkal University of Culture and received the University’s Gold Medal for graduating with first class and best academic degree in the university. She has more than 15 years of experience in the industrial and teaching sector. She worked as a merchandiser from product development to production in the various export house and handled with different U.S and European buyer such as A&F, Gap, Old Navy, American Eagle Out fitters Inc, (AEO), Land’s End, Target, Bonton, Kohl’s, Catherine Stores, Walmart, J.jill, Cold Water Creek and Club Monaco, etc. Additionally, she has academic experience at BIFT (Bhubaneswar Institute of Fashion Technology), ITT (Institute of Textile Technology) and Apparel Training and Design Center (ATDC), Ministry of Textiles, Cuttack. Thereafter, she worked as Professional Designer (Handicrafts), O/o Development Commissioner (Handicrafts)M & SEC, Bhubaneswar; she worked there to help artisans to create new Designs in various craft.
